results.title: Cell biology: mitosis and DNA
results.brief_description: Describes the structure and duplication process of the DNA molecule. Uses microphotography and animation to show the division of a living cell. Illustrates the stages of the mitotic process and explains the meiotic process. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Cell biology: life functions
results.brief_description: Investigates the chemical and physical processes in the living cell which provide a basis for the life functions. Considers diffusion, osmosis, energy production, reproduction, movement and idgestion. Describes chemical reactions involving such enzymes as DNA, RNA, ATP and ADP. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Cell 2
results.brief_description: Macromolecules such as DNA, RNA and the proteins are the fundamental building blocks of cells. This video focusses on the three fundamental cellular processes: transcription, translation and replication. The sequence of events which take place during these complex processes are explaines step-by-step, and are visualised through computer animation. Suitable for Secondary level students.

results.title: Cell 1
results.brief_description: This video aims to give insight into the structure of cells, showing mutual as well as divergent characteristics of bacterial (procaryotic) and human (eukaryotic) cells. The structure and function of DNA, RNA and proteins are explained. Basic cellular proceses, the structure of the macromolecules, and the three-dimensional conformations are shown in computer generated models. Sutiable for Secondary level students.

results.title: Celebrations
results.brief_description: Features two films recounting the history and development of the SEC. “Fifty Years of Service” focuses on the history of electricity in Victoria from the late 1800’s to the development of the SEC in 1919. Highlights the achievements of Sir John Monash, the first General Manager and Chairman of the SEC. Looks at the development of power plants at Yallourn, Morwell, Hazelwood and Kiewa. Examples of the impact of electricity on domestic life at the time is shown with new appliances such as hair dryers and vacuum cleaners entering the home. (33 min) “Generations of Power” is another historical retrospective this time with comments from several SEC staff members from between the 1940’s to 1990’s. Includes a decade by decade look at the impact of electricity on Victorian Society. (23 min)

results.title: Celebration: the Larwill Tapestry
results.brief_description: Established by the State Government of Victoria in 1976, the Victorian Tapestry Workshop has garnered itself an international reputation as a leader in the industry. In 1999 the Government decided to present a gift to the new Singapore Esplanade Theatre and visual artist David Larwill was selected to create a design that would be turned into a tapestry. This documentary covers the process of creating the tapestry, warping the loom, dying the wool, hitching on, interpreting the artwork, hitching off and the cutting off ceremony. Includes a biography of the artist and his work, as well as a brief spiel on the artist exchange program involving 3 Singapore artists, culminating in an exhibition at the Victorian College of the Arts. Sue Walker, Director, Victorian Tapestry Workshop is also interviewed on her involvement in the project.

results.title: Celebration of life: trees
results.creator_credit: Paul Fillinger Productions and Paul Fillinger
results.brief_description: The beauty and wonder of our natural environment gives cause for a celebration. The viewer joins a group of youngsters discovering and enjoying everything about trees and forests. It is a reminder of the people-nature activities that can be enjoyed. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Ceiling with scrapite finish
results.creator_credit: Topical Film Company and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plastering”.
One of a series of four films which gives a basic training in plastering as applied to building construction. The use of expanded metal lathing is demonstrated and the way in which the plaster adheres to it. Three coats are applied, render, float and set. The making of dots and screeds is shown. Before the final coat is applied the cornice is run. The method of cutting the mould for this and the addition of horse and handle is shown. Screeds and running rule are fitted in position and the cornice is run. Finally, the finishing coat is applied to the ceiling.

results.title: Cecily (K)
results.brief_description: An animated film about a little girl who, discovering she can fly by flapping her ears, takes off for Africa. She makes friends with the elephants, who have ears as big as hers, and forms an elephant orchestra which becomes world famous. Based on the story by Milos Macourek.
